comedian shuler king just posted a video on a picture he was sent from this kid that tore up his allowance because it wasn‚Äôt the amount he expected
every time that kid asks for money, give him a shred
cashier shared she had a lady at some time ring up ~$70/80 of stuff and pulled out a $20 like ‚Äúdo you think the store could help me out with the rest‚Äù
Been there, done that.
Albertson's policy was: Well, the store can't help you, but if the cashier wants to foot the bill, that's their choice.
Fukkin' sucked.
Pressure from management and the customers in the know to pay for other peoples' foodstuffs while barely taking in more than minimum wage ourselves..
Stemmed from the issue that cashiers had vastly different payscales.
Older cashiers from previous contracts had no glass cielings and made $25+ an hour. But anyone hired more recently made effectively minimum wage, up to $111.50.
So the better paid cashiers had no problem with chipping in for their customers, but the rest of up financially just couldn't.
Leading to customers getting upset, "What do you mean you can't? Matt helps me all the time!"
Well lady, Matt makes more than twice as much as I do. Sorry bout that I guess.
we have someone like that
overly helps people
and then that conditions entitled customers to be more entitled
Proper response: "I'm sorry sir / ma'am, charity must be given not taken.  One must secure one's self in order to effectively help others."
one woman has us literally weight every rotisserie chicken we have at the moment she arrives to get the biggest
Aka, "Piss off, you're telling me you're entitled to MY money from MY labor.  Regardless of MY intentions of using it."
he spoils customers and it got to a point we‚Äôd get customers calling our department asking for him to ask for something
I've helped customers out on occassion
Usually they're some poor soul who are trying to get somewhere and they've run out of gas and have very little money.
Honestly, I ended up giving away a ton of free shit myself.
Either I did it, or they complained, got a manager, got me in minor trouble, and then they get the free shit anyways.
The worst off soul I met literally ran out of gas as he drove into the parking lot
Minor crap like a steak ringing up for a penny? Fuck it mate, enjoy your penny steak.

I‚Äôve given extras to people but it‚Äôs usually because we‚Äôre out of one thing or another, they‚Äôve been unbelievably nice about having to wait for the single worker to get to them, or maybe because they‚Äôve been polite
But catching people swapping barcodes so that $150 roasts ring up for $5. Nah, fuck off.
people are seen doing that kind of thing in self checkout all the time
Had one family in particular that tried it fucking constantly.
"Oh! How could that barcode have possibly been swapped out like that??? Such a mystery!
People have been interviewed on the subject
Some do it for the thrill
Some do it chronically for small items every now and then
Also caught them shuffling entire areas of the shelves so that things are improperly labeled/priced.
much like the mystery as to how their brain got swapped out with flat air
And then there are the entitled assholes
The people who reason that "the store is making ME work.  That's THEIR job and FUCK THEM if they think they're gonna make me do THEIR job."
"So FUCK THEM, I'm not paying for all this shit."
plenty do it around here cause if the amount is small enough, security won‚Äôt persecute
Legit. I was helping another customer fill out her WIC and saw the father one by one moving the 25 pound bags of rice over to the 5 pound area.
Then when the 25 lb bags he tried to buy rang up as "too much" he tried to bring me back to "show me" how all the 25lb bags were in the "wrong" area.
I sense juicy justice inc
